name: Black URL bar and tabs bar.
description: The URL and the Tabs' bar colored in black to make it cohesive with the dark mode on Mozilla. Also I have added a 50px space on the right of the menu button—addons, options, etc.— because it was hidden by my Windows toolbar which I have on the right of the screen.
additional_info:
-2018/9/13: the last update on Mozilla Quantum v.64 messed up some of the colors. With this fix—I mean mine—you can choose the Black Shine theme. Before that I could not get rid of the grey background on some menus as in Tool Menu or similar. Now it is an all black theme.

-If you do not know how to change Chrome.css in Mozilla do a Google search. It is relatively easy to find a tutorial that fits your knowledge level.

-The last feature—the space to the left—it is hidden by default so If you want this feature just delete in the code the two "/* */" with the text inside. Not the code just the 

[b]/* delete this text between "/ *" if you want the menu button to the left as in the image[/b]
[i]#Leave the code here intact[/i]

[b]*/[/b]
